author: @abdulazizataullaev
text: Dear Alex Freberg  Hope you are doing well.   My name is Abdulaziz Ataullaev.  Thanks for the great content. I took some of your recommended courses and started my job as an entry-level data analyst.  Would it be possible for you to answer my question, please?   Thanks for you helpful really interesting content I found the way to become a data analyst.   I learned Excel then I have been learning SQL and was planning to learn Python. Also, working as a junior data analyst in a part-time job. The company that I work is in retail industry which sell shoes and they use local CRM system which is like Slaesforce. I get data from CRM system which means there is no need to use SQL. I was surprised how come I do not use SQL because company is still considered as a startup and do not allow analysts to use SQL yet. As an analyst I have access to any data that I need but it is sometimes time consuming to gather all the necessary data from CRM system. So I asked the permission to get the data by using SQL but they said there is no way.   So my question is what should I do? I thought, I would use SQL but there is no permission for using it. Now I am going to learn Python and keep working on my current job because I like what I am doing, I am working on real business and having great experience.    Thanks for taking you time to read my comment.  I am looking forward to your answer.  P.S. I wrote this all here because I thought it would be helpful for your audience.
